sentence: Church & Dwight Company, Inc. ( CHD ) will begin trading ex-dividend on February 11, 2016.
A cash dividend payment of $0.355 per share is scheduled to be paid on March 01, 2016.
Shareholders who purchased CHD prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 5.97% increase over the prior quarter.
The previous trading day's last sale of CHD was $88.49, representing a -2.47% decrease from the 52 week high of $90.73 and a 15.15% increase over the 52 week low of $76.85.
CHD is a part of the Basic Industries sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever NV ( UN ).
CHD's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $3.03.
Zacks Investment Research reports CHD's forecasted earnings growth in 2016 as 7.73%, compared to an industry average of 3.7%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the CHD Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
